1.question: Paul got a box of 479 crayons for his birthday. At the end of the school year, he only had 134 left. How many crayons had been lost or given away?

3.question: Cindy’s mom baked 1215 cookies. Paul’s dad baked 1112 cookies. They both brought them to school for a party. How many cookies did they have altogether?

2.question: 179 birds were sitting in a tree. 38 more birds flew up to the tree. How many birds were there altogether in the tree?

5.question: 231 birds were sitting in a tree. Some more fly up to the tree. Then there were 312 birds in the tree. How many more fly up to the tree?

4.question: Beth has 106 crayons. She gives 54 of them away to Jen. How many crayons does Beth have left?

6.question: 64 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop, some more children got on the bus. Then there were 78 children altogether on the bus. How many children got on the bus at the bus stop?
